habitat_description: Endemic to the Ozark Plateau in Arkansas, Missouri, and Oklahoma, Plethodon angusticlavius is found in mesic forest and woodland environments with moist leaf litter, rocky talus, and caves; preferring rocky habitats such as sandstone cedar glades especially during the breeding and courtship season (Thurow 1955, Meshaka and Trauth 1995, Smith 1961, Reinbold 1979, Petranka 1979, Meshaka 2005). Rocky habitats as such described are therefore a limiting factor in this species' distribution (Petranka 1979, Meshaka 2005).
